message.content:
<<<api>>>: Activity.setContentView
<<<code>>>: @Override
protected void onPostExecute(String s) {
    super.onPostExecute(s);
    runOnUiThread(new Runnable() {
        @Override
        public void run() {
            showColumnCounts();
        }
    });
    dataDownloadCompleteToast();
}
<<<explanation>>>: The onPostExecute method of AsyncTask runs on the UI thread, but if you are performing any long-running operations within it, it is possible that the UI updates are not happening immediately. In this case, you can use the runOnUiThread method to ensure that the showColumnCounts method is executed on the UI thread. By wrapping the call to showColumnCounts in the runOnUiThread method, you are ensuring that it is executed on the UI thread and any UI updates will be reflected immediately.
